citation.article-title: Classification of eight new species of ammonia-oxidizing bacteria: Nitrosomonas communis sp. nov., Nitrosomonas ureae sp. nov., Nitrosomonas aestuarii sp. nov., Nitrosomonas marina sp. nov., Nitrosomonas nitrosa sp. nov., Nitrosomonas eutropha sp. nov., Nitrosomonas oligotropha sp. nov. and Nitrosomonas halophila sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Nitrosomonas halophila sp. nov.
Nitrosomonas halophila (hal.o'phi.la. Gr. n. halos, salt; Gr. adj. philos, loving; L fem. adj. halophila, salt-loving)
The description is based on only one isolate.
Cells have an obligate salt requirement, with optimum growth around 300 mM NaCl.
The G + C content of the DNA is 53.8 mol% (Tm).
Habitat: the only strain was isolated from the North Sea.
Type strain : Nm 1 - culture collection of the Institut fur Allgemeine Botanik der Universitat Hamburg, Mikrobiologische Abteilung, FRG.
